discoveredAssets: localhost:3000 - AUTH 05 Web Application (Apache 2.4.25, PHP 5.6.40) - Ports 3000
http://localhost:3000/index.php - Login endpoint accepting GET/POST parameters (username, password)
http://localhost:3000/static/springfield_background.jpg - Static image asset serving background image

targets.objective: Test for authentication vulnerabilities including SQL injection, parameter tampering, credential bypass, privilege escalation to admin, GET/POST method manipulation, and authentication logic flaws
targets.rationale: Primary authentication endpoint that accepts username and password parameters. Application checks for admin status and rejects non-admin credentials. This is the critical entry point for authentication testing and potential privilege escalation.

targets.objective: Test for authentication vulnerabilities, input validation flaws, XSS in form fields, CSRF protection, and session management weaknesses
targets.rationale: Main application page with login form. Form submits to index.php via GET method which is non-standard for authentication. Requires testing for form-based vulnerabilities and insecure authentication design patterns.

targets.objective: Test for directory traversal, path manipulation, arbitrary file access, and static resource access control
targets.rationale: Static resources are accessible and may indicate path traversal vulnerabilities or information disclosure through file access manipulation.

keyFindings: [HIGH] PHP 5.6.40 is end-of-life (EOL) - contains known security vulnerabilities (PHP 5.6 reached EOL August 2018)
[HIGH] GET-based authentication parameters detected - credentials transmitted in URL parameters rather than POST body with security headers
[HIGH] Admin status checking detected - indicates multi-user/multi-role functionality with potential privilege escalation vectors
[HIGH] No HTTPS/TLS enforcement - credentials transmitted over HTTP in cleartext
[MEDIUM] No API documentation endpoints found (robots.txt, sitemap.xml, swagger.json, openapi.json)
[MEDIUM] Directory listing disabled (403 Forbidden on /static/) but individual files accessible
[MEDIUM] Static resources directory protected from listing but accessible via direct path
[LOW] Simpsons-themed application - likely CTF/training environment with intentional vulnerabilities
[LOW] No advanced security headers detected (no X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, CSP, HSTS observed)
